trial_identification.studytitle: Miniprobe confocal laser microscopy for the detection of invisible neoplasia in patients with BarrettÂ´s esophagus
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Comparison of confocal laser microscopy (CLM) probe with bioptic histology for detection of neoplasia in patients with Barrett's esophagus

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Other diseases of the mouth, teeth, oesophagus, digestive system including liver and colon

interventions.interventions: Use of endoscope guided in vivo miniprobe confocal laser microscopy in the diagnosis of Barrett neoplasia. Each patient will be examined once at their presentation for Barrett surveillance examination.
interventions.comparator: CLM recordings from Barrett premarked mucosa with histology obtained from the same sites.

primaryOutcome.outcome: sensitivity and specificity of miniprobe CLM to detect high grade intraepithelial neoplasia or early esophageal adenocarcinoma using histology as the gold standard.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: One timepoint, at presentation for screening or surveillance endoscopies.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: interobserver agreement of blindly evaluated CLM recordings.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: One timepoint, at presentation for screening or surveillance endoscopies.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: All patients with known Barrett esophagus who present for an upper endoscopy (EGD)
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Phase I (establishment of CLM neoplasia criteria) - none. Phase II (testing of criteria) - only patients with no apparent macroscopic lesions within the Barrett segment.
